dialogues.text: Well, there's nobody special!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, then:) I mean, it's not easy in this day and age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeting ... people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I've been dating longer than I've been driving. I can't believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never really...went through a... dating period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a disgusting process. You haven't missed anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA nods in agreement, but her face tells us she feels missed a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY, cleaned and dressed up - his hair moussed back, th is too big.  PARRY paces back and forth in the hallway as tries to staple the sleeves of the suit shorter for PARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stand still so I can do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry....I'm just so excited. (JACK smiles) You must have felt this way when you first met Anne, huh? Where did you two meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bar called Hellfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tch...how romantic. Yeah. If I wasn't already committed to Lydia, boy. Except Anne'd never go for me though. She loves you too much. And you really love her, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But that's not the only reason people get together or..stay together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the other reasons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK thinks a moment, then answers plainly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY puts his arm on JACK'S shoulder and speaks very sin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnest) You love her alot Jack. You're ... crazy about her...It's just that, sometimes, you're a little bit of an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is surprised by the remark and abruptly focuses on P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA is a little more loose and talkative now as ANNE re her glass, then takes LYDIA'S other hand to apply the sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) ...My mother calls every week. Like a recurring nightmare. "So, have you met anyone?"..."No mom".. "So what's going to happen?"... "I don't know Mom"... I only thank God I moved out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you lived with her for that long. If I had to live with my mother, I'd stab myself six times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think some people are meant to be alone. (she takes a slug) Maybe I was a man in a former life and I used women for pleasure so now I'm paying for it - which would be fine, if I could just remember some of the pleasure parts... (drinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you. What is the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like I make any impression on people... At office parties I spend my time re-arranging the hors d'oeuvres as people eat them, so the platters will always look full. I don't start conversations because I have no idea how to end them...I think I'm just meant to live in the background of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true...You gotta ease up... Conversations have a life of their own. You gotta just go with it...We're having a lovely conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bluntly) I'm paying you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE drops her hand. SHE's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, let me tell you something! I'm not that kind of person. I don't do people favors. If I talk to you it's because I want to. So we're not all ...uh...Jerri Hall...Big deal... What a boring world if we were. You do the best you can with what you got. You're not so so invisible, ya know... You want make an impression? Try this; you can be a real bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her face lights up) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA smiles at the thought of having such an impressiona personality.. EXT. VIDEO POP - NIGHT. JACK tries to calm PARRY down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here...you're all crooked. (HANDS HIM WALLET) Here's my wallet, so you can pay for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK adjusts PARRY'S tie, then undoes it and re-ties. PARRY takes wallet, keeping his eyes on JACK, as JACK pri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're a nice man, Jack. Doing all this for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK doesn't pay attention as PARRY'S expression grows pa frightened. HE suddenly raps his arms around JACK and whi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK, uncomfortable at the intimacy, tries to comfort him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I feel so much for her...I feel like something awful is going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nothing bad's going to happen. Anne'll be there. I'll be there. Nothing bad will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE and LYDIA share a drink....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard being a woman. I don't care what anybody says...People say we have choices - we have no choices...My grandma used to say that, for a woman in this world, behind every door there's either death...or husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA cracks up laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sister-in-law of death"...That's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHE takes another sip as JACK knocks on the door and ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne...! (to LYDIA) Oh hi? How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia loses her smile and becomes self-conscious and prot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry, it's Lydia Sinclair - our membership winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK turns to find that PARRY is still outside the apartm HE crosses to PARRY. The two whisper intensely....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well..everything's closed up. We thought we'd get some dinner. (overplaying it) Say!....Anybody up for Chinese? (to LYDIA) Have you eaten? Would you like to come along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises, uncomfortable) Oh, no..I have to get home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nails!! Watch the nails!!... (LYDIA sits back down) Listen, you still have to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY stands in b.g. with JACK, whispering....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really..I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? What did I tell you? Why don't you come? It's just dinner. You'll have something to tell your mother next time she calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA smiles as PARRY and JACK reach an agreement. All four turn to each other spontaneously and say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY and LYDIA walk and talk.  ANNE and JACK walk behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I..uh..I get to read some of the books but mostly I..just calculate production costs from first edition hard cover publication to paperback. After paperback it's basically someone else's problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it sound exciting? There's absolutely nothing exciting about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Parry talks, he picks up a piece of garbage on the sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're calculating costs that could have an affect on whether or not the book is published and if it is, it could be a book that... ....might somehow change the way people think or act - a book can do that. And you would be a part of creating a cultural shift that could change our society forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry drops the garbage in a garbage can and is almost about to browse through it when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry is alerted by Jack that this would be inappropriate However, he does take a wire champagne cork wrapper, indi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We mostly publish trashy romance novels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - empires have fallen because of trashy romances...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry seems to be fashioning something out of the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...Romance is romance no matter what kind it is...It could be a Victorian lady kidnapped by a viral sea captain with a hairy chest...or a horny pizza boy seduced by a housewife with a hairy upper lip. As long as there's heart, passion, and little bit of fantasy...romance is the stuff of dreams...there's always more to trash than meets the eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this, Parry shows her his creation - a little wire c made from the champagne wire. Lydia is impressed. Their eyes meet for a dangerous moment, until: A LARGE MAN walks by, bumping into LYDIA without apology knocking Parry's gift to the ground....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LARGE MAN continues walking as PARRY reaches to his b pocket to pull out his SLINGSHOT when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY begrudgingly lets him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry!...Parry - is that you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry spots a familiar homeless face, sitting on the curb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Martin...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you look all duded up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lydia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you Lydia! Got a quarter?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY smiles proudly.  A mortified LYDIA reachs in her pu and hands Martin a quarter...Anne and Jack watch in disbe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. God bless... (to Parry) Nice girl...Have you set the date yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia hurries away. Parry follows....The walk continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were neighbors for a couple for weeks on Sutton Place. Lydia You lived on Sutton Place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yep! Right on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to save it) Huh...the restaurant's just around the corner here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod. After a beat, Lydia asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do - for a living I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm in search of the Holy Grail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK smacks his own forehead, exasperated. ANNE gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE and LYDIA sit opposite JACK and PARRY. THEY are served three large orders of dumplings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh..I could eat all of these

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA is nervous about this. As everyone begins to eat, S eyes her chopsticks with reluctance. PARRY looks at her and smiles encouragingly. LYDIA forces a smile back, picks up her chopsticks and di PARRY watches her in adoration. JACK subtly tries to get to stop staring. But PARRY is glued to his vision. LYDIA, even more awkward now with her new nails, drops he dumpling into her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh..god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save her from embarassment, PARRY drops his dumpling i lap as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA takes her napkin and dips it into a glass of water. PARRY follows suit. When LYDIA removes the napkin, her glass falls over. PARRY forces his glass over, as well. ANNE and JACK are looking at this mirror exercise in fasc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LYDIA) Can't take us anywhere, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYDIA can't help but smile - a little more at ease now. G she is not the clumsy center of attention. JACK leans over and whispers to ANNE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're made for each other. And it scares me.

dialogues.speaker: LATER IN THE EVENING.
dialogues.text: WE PAN the table as everyone eats their main courses. LYDIA, we discover, has another eating idiosyncracy. SHE unconsciously, but quite loudly, smacks her mouth when sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK..SMACK...SMACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR THIS SMACKING OFF CAMERA as we begin on JACK; try to look at LYDIA but having difficulty enjoying his own m CAMERA moves to PARRY, staring at her, helplessly in love paying any attention to his own food; moving to LYDIA "SM SMACKING" , beginning to accept PARRY'S attraction in her warming up to the idea, SHE throws a smile at him in betw "smacks"; and finally ANNE, chewing quietly, staring at J with her eyes widened twice their normal size, indicating disbelief at LYDIA'S vocal variety of noises.

dialogues.speaker: PARRY
dialogues.text: gazing at his sweetheart, a song to seranade comes to mind and he softly begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia... Oh Lydia... That encyclopedia.  Oh Lydia the tattooed lady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gentle voice counterbalances the odd lyrics and makes it sound like a love song. Anne eyes Jack to stop him. Jack is about to make an attempt but can't seem to find the way, so he doesn't bother. Lydia doesn't know how to respond either.  At first she smiles politely, then she pretends to be too busy eating to listen -- but something about Parry's sincerity pulls her in.  His face glows as he floats the lyrics across the table to her.  Slowly, her "smacking" subsides, she lowers her fork, forgets her self-consciousness and listens to Parry -- slightly hypnotized; like a little girl watching a ballerina for the first time. Jack is fascinated by Parry's complete adoration of this mess of a woman.  He looks to Anne, who tries to continue her meal nonchalantly.  He notices her bra strap hanging out from her sweater. CAMERA CUTS BACK AND FORTH between the exposed strap and Jack, as Parry continues seranading O.S.  Anne realizes Jack is staring at her and immediately thinks something's wrong.  But Jack just smiles at her.  His hand reaches across the table, not to fix her sweater, but to take her hand.  Anne is in shock.  She slips her hand into his and smiles back, her eyes almost tearing. When Parry finishes, he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be all right... I mean would you mind... if I walked you home tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia nods.  From O.S., Parry's hand holds a napkin and gently dabs a stain of soy sauce on her sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell ya, I'm very surprised. She seemed to go for him. Hmmm... There's somebody for everybody, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK very pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I can't believe I did it. You think it'll work out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's knows. My Aunt Marge used to say, "some matches are made in heaven, some are made in hell and some are made in hardware stores".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing it's just...I begining to understand you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Well...I think you should feel very proud. You did a real nice thing for somebody else. I'm very proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great. Thanks alot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE kisses her hard and long. ANNE pulls away to catch her SHE is surprised, to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK tenderly brushes her hair off her face. HE kisses he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY and LYDIA walk - noticably more comfortable with ea other than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more. I want to know everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't any more to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuine) No, really..believe me - there isn't any more. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never say anything I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean you don't have to say nice things to me... That kind of thing is a little old fashioned for what we're about to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we about to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you're walking me home.  I... I guess you're sort of... attracted to me and you'll want to come upstairs for... coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then we'll probably have a drink and talk and get comfortable with each other and... and we'll... then you'll sleep over and then in the morning... (driving herself into a complex) ... you'll be distant and you won't be... able to stay for breakfast... you'll just have some coffee maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we'll exchange phone numbers and you'll leave and never call and I'll go to work and feel great for the first hour and then slowly turn into a piece of dirt by lunch.  Why am I putting myself through this? (to Parry, as she quickens her pace) It was very nice... uh meeting you. Good night..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks quickly away.  Parry stops, confused to say the least, then runs after her.  Lydia is just about to enter the front door of her building when Parry stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no wonder.  We just met, made love and broke up all in the space of thirty seconds and I can't even remember the first kiss which is the best part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you're very nice... b...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you, but I think maybe you should shut up now... (Lydia is surprised) ... I'm not coming up to your apartment.  That was never my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... You mean you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply sincere) Oh no, I want to. (sweetly) I've got a hard-on for you the size of Canada... but I don't... want just one night.  I have a confession to make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stop!... (pause, he looks at her) ... I'm in love with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia is about to speak when Parry puts his hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's not just from tonight.  I've known you for a long time.  I see you come out of work every day.  I walk with you to lunch.  I know what you order... I see you buy Baby Ruths before going back in... (slowly removes his hand) I know how you feel on certain days by whether or not you go into the bookstore... (Lydia listens with fascination) ... I know you hate your job and you don't have many friends and you sometimes feel like you're not as... as wonderful as everybody else and you're a little uncoordinated (Lydia begins to cry) ... and feeling like you're the only one who's as separate and... alone as you are... and I love you.   I love you.  I think you're the greatest thing since... spice racks and I would be knocked out several times if I even got just a first kiss.  But I'll be back in the morning.  And I won't be distant.  And I will call if you let me... But I still don't drink coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him, tentatively -- almost awkwardly.  Parry feels a surge of emotion that makes his whole body tremble.  Lydia separates from him and looks into his eyes.  She pinches his cheek, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; earnestly) You are real, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again.  Then Lydia quickly pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... You can call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs into the building, afraid to linger and ruin the moment.  Parry stands transfixed, his eyes following her. Lydia pauses briefly to look back.  She is so excited. She smiles and turns toward the elevator... her skirt spinning with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She re-enacts the entire love scene in her mind, to make sure it went as well as she thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY is standing frozen... We don't know whether he's looking ahead of him or in his mind's eye... He appears anxious and frightened as he steps back, away from Lydia's building... He senses someone is watching him. Parry smiles.  But suddenly it is as if everything has gone into SLOW MOTION.  His eyes focus on her skirt as it swirls around as she turns... His expression grows dark: O.S. we hear a horses HOOVES moving in slowly as CAMERA moves to CLOSEUP.  He slowly turns his head and looks down the block to the corner to see: The Red Knight.  He sits upon his horse as if waiting for Parry.  The street lamps cast a glow around his imposing figure.  The night air lifts his cape up around his massive shoulders. Parry, vulnerable, in love, whispers plainly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have this.

dialogues.speaker: THE RED KNIGHT
dialogues.text: silent, unforgiving, unrelenting. Parry begins to move away, taking a step back and then another and another... until he is running down toward the opposite corner. The Red Knight shifts his horse into Parry's direction and begins to charge.  Parry runs through deserted city streets -- running for his life; the sounds of the Red Knight GALLOPINGS grows closer.  The Red Knight, looks like a surreal figure hunting his prey. As Parry runs, IMAGES/MEMORIES begin to flood his mind  uncontrollably;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance arriving at a hospital... his wounded wife being moved on a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry running away from the Knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry and his wife at the side bar.  He is making her laugh uncontrollably.  He sees Edwin in the doorway, making nothing of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry still running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sstttoppp!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passers-by on the street witness the familiar sight of a bum screaming at thin air then turn away.  We hear the GALLOPING getting louder. Parry runs, mumbling incoherently.  People on the street get out of his way or snicker behind his back.  The Red Knight gallops toward PARRY, as he runs; his face wet with tears -- yet contorting with angry, incomprehensible reprisals.  People on the street pay no attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bar with broken glass surrounded by police and spectators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry and his wife waltzing.  CLOSEUP on their clasped hands as Parry maneuvers a ring on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife's lifeless hand lifted onto the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, Parry's wife stops dancing to look at the ring.  Parry smiles.  It is his proposal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance driving away with Parry holding his wife's hand in the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancing, his wife embraces him as she accepts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's face on a TV news broadcast with a reporter commenting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry has run all the way to the promenade along the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!... Where are you!!!  Where are you!! (softer, dropping to his knees) Where are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two juvenile delinquents, Leather and Windbreaker, come strutting down the promenade, in SLOW MOTION.  Parry looks toward them, as if surrendering. Through PARRY'S POV we see the two youths are being lead by the Red Knight on his horse. Parry, tear-stained face, rises to meet them.  The Youths reach Parry and surround him.  Leather flicks open a switchblade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We're tired of looking at you people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry stands before them, surrendering to his fate. Through his POV, the Red Knight is pointing a sword at him in front of Leather and his switchblade.  He slashes at Parry's chest as we...

dialogues.speaker: PROMENADE
dialogues.text: as Parry sinks to his knees... The youths close in around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the bathroom door, we hear the toilet FLUSH. Anne exits in an imitation silk kimono, feeling very much the satisfied woman.  She crosses into the living room and finds Jack, on the phone in mid-conversation, beside his open box of radio tapes.  She hugs him from behind as he talks, still warm from their all night lovemaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited, very "on") ... Well, ya know, I'm feeling good, Lou... I don't know how else to put it... I... I had some personal things to work out and... and I have and... (listens, then:) Yeah... Well, the thing is... I want to work again... I want to get back into it... you think that's possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne releases her hug -- looking surprised, pleased, impressed... she stands by, waiting to ask Jack what's up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone) I understand... (obedient) I am... I won't... I will... (beaming) Great!  Thanks a lot, Lou... Tuesday's fine. (listens) Okay... Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone elated... Anne can't wait to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's going on?  Who's Lou again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed she doesn't remember) My agent.  I called my agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding!  What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says if I want to get back to work, no problem.  He wants me to come in and talk and... and... that's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah!  Oh, honey, that's terrific!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a big hug.  Jack is first to break away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (organizing tapes) I've got to put these tapes in some kind of order... and... Oh, I should get my sports jacket cleaned... (he crosses to the closet) ... There's coffee if you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made coffee?... You're going back to work and you made coffee?... I love this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack does not respond as he looks through the closet. Anne gets her coffee and sits -- watching Jack move about so full of energy and focus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's so great to see you like this, honey... I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at jacket) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she smiles and drinks) Ya know, I'm thinkin' -- with another income coming in, I would love to get a bigger place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops organizing for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... I don't want to rush things -- you have to get a job first, but I'm so sure that's gonna happen I'm not even thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack brings out his sports jacket, then returns to his tapes, hoping he can avoid having to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh, these tapes are a mess.  I don't know where to begin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I would love to start looking at least.  You know, maybe a two bedroom or even, maybe the top floor of a house -- like in Brooklyn or Staten Island...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at her, not knowing what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... What?... You don't want to commute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not... Come here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns her around and cuddles her up in his arms, with her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're an incredible woman Anne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne breaks away suddenly and looks at him, sternly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm an incredible woman?"  What is this, a death sentence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I... I think we should talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aware and suspicious) You want to talk?  Come on, Jack... Did I cross the line by mentioning the future or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne shifts her body to face him directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... Listen, so much has happened and I think it would be a good thing for both of us if we slowed things down a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowed things down?  Where have I been?  Have we been going fast!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, I'm just not sure about... making such definite plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Anne stares at him like he's speaking Dutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lost.  What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits them both down, takes her hand in his, takes a breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a real... real difficult time for me... The past year or so... And now, for the first time, Anne, I feel like I'm above water. I feel like I know a lot more than I did, and I don't want to make any mistakes so... I think what I need is some time... to make the right choices.  And... I think that maybe... I need to be alone for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne is speechless -- for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'd like to focus on my career - - now than I can, now that everything's all right... Parry's taken care of... and... Like I said, I feel like I know a lot more now and I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) First of all, let me tell you something -- you don't know shit. Second of all, as far as we go, what time do you need?  What have we been doing here, except time?  Have I ever... ever pressured you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  So what time do you need?  I love you -- you love me -- you want to get your career going, great!  I'd like to be a part of it -- I think I deserve that!  So what do you need to figure out alone!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack doesn't answer.  Pause.  Anne is afraid she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) All right.  I'm going to ask you one question. (summoning up all her strength) Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even give me that?!  What were you gonna do, Jack?... Just gonna organize your life... (indicates the box) ... walk out that door, move in by yourself and what -- drop the news when you find somebody else?  What were you planning to do, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know.  I just said all I want is some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting back tears) Bullshit!  If you're going to hurt me, you hurt me now -- not some long... drawn out hurt that takes weeks of my life because you don't have the balls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, then:) All right... I'll pack my stuff tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne slaps him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been doing here!  Huh! I wanna know!  What have you been doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen!  We both got something out of it, all right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  What did I get?  What did I get I couldn't've gotten from somebody with no name any night of the week?  You think your company is such a treat?  Your moods, your... (sarcastic) "pain", your problems... You think you're entertaining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want to stay with me for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE physically attacks him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECAUSE I LOVE YOU!...STUPID!...FUCKIN!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK blocks her blows and holds her arms. ANNE surrenders her tears. HE is about to embrace her, when she pulls awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No....You don't get to be nice now. I'm not gonna play some game with you where we act like friends so you can walk  out  here feeling good about yourself. I'm not a liar. If you're gonna leave me then that's what we call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. JACK answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?...Yeah...My wallet? What do you mean?....(his face drops) What?....What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARRY lays in bed - his face bandaged, his arms in a cast his chest tightly rapped.  HE has been severly beaten. JA and ANNE stand at the foot of the bed in shock. A DOCTOR The DOCTOR is young, dedicated and inexperienced enough t still feel compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear you. (JACK and ANNE turn) Hi...I'm Dr. Weintraub.... (shakes hands) I was on duty when they brought him in...I've been going over his record... He was brought in once before I understand... (reads) ..."catatonic  stupor"...condition  rendered him non-verbal for a period of -...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah so? The guy's beat up - he...he probably has a concussion or something, right? (DOCTOR doesn't reply) He'll snap out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not ... Then again, I'm not sure. The beating's bad but it's not the problem... It seems he's.. re-experiencing the catatonia... So, like before, he could snap out it in an hour or in thirteen months or thirteen years... ....I don't know. There's no way to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But..How could that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not unusual in his case... Sometimes victims of tragedies are subject to the brain's replay system. The brain never loses anything - it just stores it up and waits. A person could actually re-experience the full effect of a tragedy, long after the event took place. Are you relatives? (JACK shakes his head) Well, it doesn't matter. We'll take care of it. He'll have to be sent back to the same institution.. (HE checks the record)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I was a relative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have the option to care for him at home but my advice is it wouldn't be the best thing for him. He needs hospital care. I just thought you could sign the release forms, but the city can do that. I wouldn't feel responsible in any way. There's really nothing you can do. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, the DOCTOR EXITS. JACK and ANNE face PARRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like a guy. Finds the woman of his dreams then falls into a coma... Poor Lydia... (SHE looks at JACK) ...Some women just have no luck, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including herself in this remark, and having cried all sh cry, She and JACK exchange one final look. SHE turns and, with all her dignity, walks out of the ward. After a BEAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne....Anne...I'll call you O.k...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But ANNE doesn't stop or turn - she keeps walking. JACK stares at PARRY. CAMERA MOVES IN TO C.U. - His face hardening, a mixture of hurt, rage and resignation. SUPER - SIX MONTHS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the studio as JACK signs off his broadcast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm gone-... Have a perfect weekend and remember on Monday, we have as our studio guest, Ben Starr - star of the recently defunct hit TV show ON THE RADIO - it's the rise and fall story of one of televisions brightest stars ruined by charges of sodomy in an Atlanta airport mens room. If you often wonder, "what IS sodomy exactly?", Ben'll have that answer and many more for you on Monday's show...Until then, don't do anything that will break your pattern of being the selfish scum sucking race you are. From one of the Botched to all of your bungled cats out there, I love ya and right back at cha!. Over and out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE flicks his monitor off as a commercial takes over. The work in silence behind him. HE rubs his tired face and si CAMERA PAUSES on JACK for a moment as he sits in silence. looks neither happy nor said, neither satisfied nor unsat HE looks blank...emotionless...as if he knows something i but he hasn't the strength or interest to find out.... THE PHONE RINGS - breaking the silence. JACK picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...Yeah Lou.... (no excitement, no energy until:) Lou, I said I want an offer or they can forget it... Well, tell them I'm meeting with the cable people about a talk show and...What?... Beth's father set it up...No, he owns it. ...Fuck you Lou...And if the network is ready to make an offer and I see a script, then fine... otherwise, forget it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK turns to see his new improved girlfriend, BETH - a t statuesque redhead in a smart Chanel outfit. BETH crosses him and they kiss...When they kiss, all the lights in the surrounding studios booths go out, as the crew heads home JACK'S STUDIO is now surrounded by blackness...After the JACK gets right to business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi..Did you talk to your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding good news) Yeeesss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly annoyed by her coquettish game) Weeellll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Daddy said...and this is word for word... He said...that he thought... that you were a home run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK knows this must mean a great deal - especially to BE but he just can't get the steam up....HE smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. He thinks you'll be a phenominal success...and he says the cable people are very excited about the meeting... I said I always knew that and I really think it was like the first time he really respected me...So thank you for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK nods "it was nothing" as his hands move up her body. Oh and I called him later to thank him but I really think you should send him a note... He wants to take us out to dinner tonight. The car's picking us up at seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK nods and watches BETH'S BREASTS pressing against her dress.  Turned on, JACK moves to her and begins fondling her, as he kisses her neck. BETH giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaaack...what are you crazy? They're people all around us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK flips a switch that send his studio into darkness an continues kissing and fondling. BETH giggles some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaack..I can't do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK begins to ease her to the floor. BETH stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this thing you have with the floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY lower O.C....We hear BETH continue OC:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's cold...I'm cold...honey... Jack, can we please do this after dinner.. in bed?...like normal people?...I really want you but I'll want you more, late. O.K. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STREET BUM, whose face we cannot see, is busy asking people for change. But no one is stopping... A SECURITY G exits the building and starts yelling at the BUM to leave A CAB pulls up and out steps JACK and LOU. THEY start walking toward the building when the BUM recognizes JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK!....JACK!....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK turns as the BUM starts for him. Simultaneously, the SECURITY GUARD intercepts the BUM, who JACK recognizes as the GAY BUM from Central Park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK!...JACK! IT'S MEE...REMEMBER ME...YOU KNOW ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUTTA HERE I SAID!!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOU tries to usher JACK into the building, but JACK stand frozen for a moment, as the GUARD pulls out a club and starts poking the GAY BUM away...JACK doesn't know what t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You KNOW that guy!? (JACK doesn't answer).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK...JACK...PLEASE CAN I TALK TO YOU? I JUST..I NEED TO TALK TO YOU, JACK...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the GUARD keeps at him...JACK realizes people are wat him and he enters the building with LOU as the GAY BUM sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK..PLEASE..JAAAAAACCKKK!!!! JAACCK!...WHY WON'T ANYBODY....WHAT'S THE MATTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But JACK disappears inside. THE GAY BUM is blocked by the HE throws his arms up and starts muttering to himself hel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hyperkenetic T.V. EXEC. is pitching JACK, who sits next

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a weekly comedy about the homeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK can't believe his fate. HE looks to a coffee table a sees a magazine front page: LANGDON CARMICHAEL BUYS VAN G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But it's not depressing in any way. We want to find a happy, upbeat way of bringing the issue of homeless to television. There are three wacky homeless characters but they're wise...they're wacky and they're wise... And the hooks is, they love being homeless. They love the freedom...they love the adventure... It's all about the joy of living...not all the bullshit we have to deal with...the money, the politics..the pressures... And we're gonna call it HOME FREE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooo... I got a rush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Jack stands up and bolts out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Where is he... Lou, is this another disappearing act with this guy or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I'm sure it's nothing... He probably had to go to the bathroom... I'll find out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack rushes out of the building to find the Gay Bum, but he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks around.  He looks at the wall of weapons and the mural of the medieval scene.  He looks through the maps, ropes plans for the robbery.  He finds the Pinnochio doll still keeping guard before the Red Knight wall of scribblings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack approaches the entrance to the lot from the street, carrying an open box of assorted deli food and coffee... He stops in the entrance and looks at the deserted lot. Gone are the little cliques of homeless, once scattered throughout the place.  Gone is the magic and danger that night cast upon the surroundings.  All Jack sees is garbage and decay. Suddenly, SIRENS from an ambulance pulls his his attentio away.  At the same time, the Black and the Irishman (from that same first night with Parry), come running out from between the two giant foundations of the bridge and bolt out of the lot.  Jack smiles in recognition as he moves to block them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Hey, guys!... Remember me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Black and the Irishman push him out of the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me the fuck alone, goddamn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Move it, for Christ sakes. Move...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Irishman shoves Jack against the fence and runs, with the Black close behind.  They disappear underneath the highway as Jack turns and sees an ambulance pulling up to the sight.  PARAMEDICS wheel a gurney from the ambulance, past Jack and into the lot between the giant foundations. Jack approaches with great trepidation.  He moves into view just in time to see the Paramedics lift the body of the Hippy bum onto the stretcher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Hey... Hey wait, I know him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paramedics stop... Jack approaches the gurney... The Hippy eyes are opened and glazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey... hey, remember me... Marvel Comics, right?... Remember Parry... Superbum?  Remember you guys saved my ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack realizes the glazed eyes are actually dead eyes. The Paramedics wheel him away;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack approaches the nurses' station when he spots a familiar face.  Lydia. We can see a change in her; the self-consciousness replaced by a self assurance, the insecurity replaced with a maturity.  She wears a handsome tailored suit.  Ja hides from her and listens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to NURSE) Excuse me but I brought new bed sheets for him last week.  They were lime colored with little watermelons on them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes... I'm sorry.  They're being cleaned.  The doctor had a little accident with a hypo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... Make sure he gets them, okay.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches her exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters a room lined on both side with beds and patients. The various patients -- all men -- are confined to their beds.  Some are mumbling inaudibly to themselves, others are rocking back and forth, others just stare off into space.  Parry sits in bed -- his eyes are dead, his body unresponsive.  Jack stands at the foot of his bed.  Parry does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!... It's Jack... How are you doing?... You look good... You do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry remains the same.  Other patients look at Jack as if he's nuts talking to a catatonic person.  Jack moves closer to him.  He picks up his hand and holds it.  Then shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... Hey... You gonna wake up for me? Huh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.  Jack leans closer into him.  His tone changes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... This isn't over is it?... You think you're going to make me do this, don't you?... (sternly) Well, forget it!  No fucking way!... I don't feel responsible for you, or for any of them!  Everybody has bad things happen to them... I'm not God. I don't decide... People survive. (beat) Say something!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other patients stop their mumblings and watch, as if Jack were an interesting TV show... Jack paces before the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... Everything's been going great! Great!  I'm... I'm gonna have my own cable talk show, with an incredible equity I might add... I... I... have an... an incredibly gorgeous fucking girlfriend... I... I am living an incredible fucking life!!!... So don't lay there in your comfortable little coma and think I'm about to risk all of that because I feel responsible for you! (to the other patients) I am not responsible! (to Parry) And I don't feel guilty... You've got it easy. (intensely) I'm out there every day.  Every day trying to figure out what the hell I'm doing... why, no matter what I have, it feels like I have nothing... So don't think I feel sorry for you! It's easy being nuts!  Try being me!... (beat) So I won't do this.  I do not believe in this.  And don't give me that stuff about me being the one!  There is nothing... Nothing special about me!  I control my own destiny -- not some overweight fairies.  I say what I'm going to do and I am not risking my life to get some fucking cup for some fucking vegetable... And even if I did do this, I want you to know it wouldn't be because I had to! It wouldn't be 'cause I feel guilty or cursed or .. or...bad or responsible or anything....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tears come. JACK gently pushes the hair off of PARRY'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Aw shit...If I do this...and I mean, IF!... It's because I want to do this... for you.  That's all!!  For you! (HE kisses PARRY'S forehead) Don't go anywhere...huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK stands on the deserted block. HE looks around at the neighboring houses - all the New Yorkers safely locked aw behind their doors, intentionally oblivious to what goes around them. JACK is holding a rope with a self-made hook looks up the at building, takes a gulp, then throws the r IT MISSES and falls back toward him - scaring him to the and making an awful sound when it lands. JACK tries again IT CATCHES. HE tugs a bit. HE begins to climb up the buil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God I live in a city where nobody looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE places a foot on the wall and begins to climb, mumblin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell am I doing? Can't fuckin believe this is my life! ...(imitates a whiny Parry)... "Oh Jack you're the one...we have to get the Grail" I'll give ya Grail, ya stupid dingbat! Climbing up walls in the middle of the goddamn city- in the middle of the goddamn night while that schmuck lays in bed dreaming about Camelot! I live through this and I'll be the King of the Idiots...What a fucking honor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE pulls and steps, pulls and steps...climbing up to a BA mid-way between the street and the roof. JACK climbs over into some exterior lighting that lines the balcony. A light is jarred loose, falling to the ground making an awful SOUND and lighting a stained glass window. JACK rai eyes and sees THE RED KNIGHT standing six feet tall, as p in the design of the stained glass window. HE stares unti HE HEARS THE SOUND OF A HORSE GALLOPING....HE freezes, th cautiously looks toward the street - but the street is vacant. The galloping stops. An eerie silence hangs in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. This is great. I'm hearing horses now. Parry will be so pleased. (HE picks up the rope and throws it to the roof) RADIO PERSONALITY TURNS SCREWBALL ON MISSION FROM GOD...I just hope when they put me away they find me a bed right next to his!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE begins to climbs from the balcony to the roof....Sudde JACK hears SIREN IN THE DISTANCE and freezes, closing his SUDDENLY, THREE POLICE CARS come barrelling down the stre sirens blasting, they screech to a halt. A dozen cops hit streets with rifles and spotlights aimed at JACK. A REPOR faces a news camera. (THE SAME REPORTER FROM EDWIN'S T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crazed radio personality dangles from the townhouse of billionaire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE jumps out of a police car and runs to the townhouse her face full of love and concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack!

dialogues.speaker: JACK OPENS HIS EYES
dialogues.text: POV - The street is empty. The siren was from an ambulanc that drives off in the distance. There are no cops, no spotlights...and no Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ball of sweat, he takes a breath and continues his climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack reaches the roof and climbs over.  He pulls the rope up and quickly moves to the skylight.  He looks down into it and sees a dark void.  He takes a breath and pulls out some masking tape.   He makes three big tape loops and applies them to the glass.  He then takes out a glass cutter and begins to cut a pane.  The SOUND, at first, is starting.  An O.S. VOICE says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being too loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's heart stops.  He looks into the darkness of the roof but sees nothing.  He tries to slow down his heart and shake away thoughts of demons in the dark.  He continues cutting.  When he finishes the entire pane, he replaces the cutter in his pocket then plasters his arm against the tape.  He gently bangs the pane and it comes loose, sticking to the tape.  He is impressed.  He places the pane on the roof and, fastening one end of the rope to a pipe, lowers the other end down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack eases himself down into a pitch black room.  But the rope doesn't reach the floor.  He dangles for a moment, fearful of falling until he realizes it is the only way to get down.  He takes a breath and releases, falling to the floor with a THUD!... The room is dark.  The moon- light barely illuminates the austere, castle-like surroundings.  Jack pulls out the page from the Architecture Today and lights a lighter.  The "Grail" is in the library on the first floor.  Jack cautiously makes his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks down the dark hallway.  At the far end he can see the top of a staircase. He heads towards it until he sees something that makes him stop dead in his tracks. Slowly, a shadow holding a shotgun emerges up the stairs against the back wall... Jack is paralyzed.  He closes his eyes.  The shadow reaches the top of the landing.  It is EDWIN MALNICK... Wearing the same expression we saw on the TV broadcast -- sad and harmless.  Jack's heart is bursting out of his chest.  Edwin calmly raises the gun, cocks it and FIRES:  the shot BLASTS down the hallway, deafening Jack.  But when he opens his eyes to see if he has been hit, there is no blood, no wound... and when he looks up, no Edwin.  He pulls himself together and continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters Carmichael's library carefully.  A small lamp is lit on a small table beside a large Chesterfield chair, which is turned facing the fireplace.  Jack spots the antique commode and crosses to it... Within the commode, sitting innocently behind two small glass doors, is the "Grail"... Jack gently opens the doors and takes out the goblet.  He holds it reverently for a moment, then, noticing an inscription, reads: TO LITTLE LANNIE CARMICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: FOR ALL HIS HARD WORK... P.S. 247 CHRISTMAS PAGENT 1932
dialogues.text: Jack can't help but smile.  He takes the chalice and turns to leave, when suddenly he notices: The bare foot of a man barely sticking out from in front of the Chesterfield chair.  Jack slowly moves around the large back of the chair to the front and sees, to his amazement:  LANGSTON CARMICHAEL, wearing only his silk pajama bottoms, asleep in the chair.  On the table beside him is an empty bottle of vodka and an empty bottle of pills. Jack doesn't know what to do, when it suddenly strikes him that Carmichael hasn't moved at all.  At first, he thinks it is another hallucination, but then he notices the pill bottle.  He takes a step toward it, the floor SQUEAKING beneath him but Carmichael remaining unconscious.  He reads the bottle:  Seconal.  Jack looks at Carmichael's limp body and checks his heart.  It is very faint. Scared, Jack slowly starts backing out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is panicked.  He wants to run away.  He looks to the front entrance and sees an alarm system indicated by a tiny beam of light that sits a few inches above the floor.  Suddenly, Jack feels calm.  He has an idea.  He knows what he is going to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack exits out the front door, setting off a slight BUZZ from the alarm.  He checks to see that no one is around, then quickly runs down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parry lies asleep in a sea of lime green and watermelons. Jack places the "Grail" in Parry's lifeless hands.  He pulls up a chair beside the bed and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I did my side of the bargain... You gonna wake up now? Huh?... (no response) Want to think about it a little more...?  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack props his feet up on Parry's bed and settles in to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CLOSE on a newspaper headline being read by an orderly:  "ACCIDENTAL SUICIDE THWARTED BY NIGHT PROWLER... Thief Didn't Know Anyone Was Home, Escapes Empty Handed"... CAMERA PANS PAST several beds until it ARRIVES at Parry's.  Jack is asleep in a chair beside him.  CAMERA ON Parry's hands as they gently come to life and grasp the chalice.  Parry opens his eyes, raising the chalice to him.  He sees Jack sleeping beside him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) I had this dream, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack remains asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I was married.  I was married to this beautiful woman.... And you were there too... (pause) I really miss her, Jack.  Is that okay?  Can I miss her now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, his eyes closed, only pretends to be asleep, but in truth he hears every word.  A tear rolls down his cheek. Parry extends one hand, placing it on Jack's shoulder while cradling the chalice with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia makes her way down the corridor, pushing her way through the swinging doors into Parry's ward.  She is stopped in her tracks by what she sees: Parry has gathered all the patients to the center of the room, and is teaching them to sing "Groovin'".  Jack is watching.  Although most are not getting it, all are having a good time.  When one of the patients turns to look at Lydia, Parry turns as well... His face lights up as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, sweetheart!  Where you been!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia loses control and begins to cry through her smile. Parry approaches and wraps his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't cry... Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia throws her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... Are you my girl?... Are you my girl...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia sobs and nods in his shoulder.  Parry holds her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE sits in her office, a cigarette dangling from her mo going over receipts. There is a knock at the door. A beat silence. ANNE raises her head to discover JACK, holding a bouquet of flowers. HE smiles. ANNE looks shocked, then - pulling herself together...THEY both are frozen in silenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!  What do you want me to do - applaud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Terrific. Going on alot of dates ... seeing lots of men... lots of dates..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK nods.  HE is uncharacteristically nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere, vulnerable) Jack please...I'm having a bad month. I'm not up to this. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE takes a breath, looks at ANNE and pushes the words out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once, ANNE is speechless. She slowly rises from behin desk in such a way that JACK takes a step back in fear. A up to him. She has no intention of making this easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I didn't get all that... Won't you run it by me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is dying. HE could hardly say it the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think..(quickly corrects himself) I...I realized...I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh-huh....You son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHE hauls off and cracks him a slap across the face that stuns him - his knees giving out, lowering him to th SHE quickly grabs his face with her hands and plants a pa kiss on his lips, that slowly causes him to rise back up. the flowers and grabs her. SHE mounts his body and begin suit. THEY go at it with such passion, they both fall to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. What rock hit YOU in the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS DOWN PARRY and JACK, lying naked, cloudbustin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful night huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.....Hey they're moving.... (pause) Am I doing that?
